11.content:
Dave sighed as he carried the last box out of the moving van, he turned to stare at his new house, the two-storey home was more than large enough for its two occupants, 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms numerous amenities and a several thousand foot backyard it was an excellent property. Sighing he hefted the box he was carrying and walked back in, the little 20 pound box doing little to tire his 5'9 160lb frame. Placing it down on the floor he took a moment to run his hand through his short black hair as he examined his bedroom...the words seemed to haunt him as they echoed in his mind. While this wasn't the home they had owned together it still affected him, for 16 years it had been their bedroom through good times and bad. When he caught that bad bout of pneumonia, the raise, and most importantly the day they had consummated their marriage vows and led to the birth of their son. "Oh Eleanor..." Dave muttered several, stray tears leaking out although he quickly wiped them away, he had to be strong not only for his sake but for Jim's as well.

"Hey Dad I'm going out" Dave turned at the sound of the voice, Jim his pride and joy. He was the one good thing that had come out of this whole fiasco, he had expected to fight tooth and nail with not only his wife but the judge to gain custody of his son. She had cheated on him, been the one who filed for the divorce she had no right to him, and thankfully the judge agreed. In return she had gotten the house prompting the move in the first place.

"Furtown..." he muttered under his breath, when he had first heard of the place it seemed too good to be true, a major metropolitan area with cheap taxes, a near perfect harmony of nature and technology, cheap property and he had been able to find work in his field of study within days of beginning a search. As the two of them had driven into town though they realized something was...off about it. This became apparent when they passed a woman walking down the street. The woman was a drop dead knock-out and Dave hated to admit that his attention strayed from the road as they passed her. Large firm breasts, beautiful russet red hair, long slender legs, tight firm ass all covered in a luxurious...coat..of...orange...fur. He almost swerved and hit a lamppost as she bent over revealing not only her ass but a several foot long bushy orange tail with a white tip. Jim thankfully was a heavy sleeper and the swerving Dave had to do to correct his mistake wasn't even enough to wake him but Dave had to wonder if it wouldn't have been better for his son to wake up at that moment.

"Just a minute I'll be right down" Dave replied before quickly making his way downstairs. Jim stood near the front door, dressed in his usual black t-shirt, and jeans, Dave couldn't help but smile as he stared at his son, the spitting image of his father...if he was 6'2, 50 pounds heavier and those 50 pounds were pure muscle. Jim was looking around like an animal trapped in a cage and Dave couldn't help but sigh to himself as he walked up and clapped Jim on the shoulder "you want to go out and explore right?"

"Y-yeah..." Jim replied hesitantly "it's not like I don't mind spending time with you dad and I know we just got here but.."

"You need some time to yourself?" Dave replied. He knew Jim hadn't had much time to really digest everything, the divorce had finished surprisingly quickly as had the purchase of the house so he was sure he still had some issues he had to face. "You can go out and explore just...be careful alright, I know you're 15 but you're all I have left" Dave replied. To his surprise Jim leapt forward wrapping him up in a tight hug.

"I know Dad, I know" Dave gently hugged his son before letting him go and giving him a light push towards the door. "I want you home in time for supper"

"Yeah Dad, I know" Jim replied a small smile on his face as he ran out the door leaving Dave alone.

"Maybe I should go explore myself" he thought slowly walking back upstairs. As he walked he couldn't help but notice the echo of each footfall, the almost oppressive feeling of emptiness the house seemed to hold. vigorously shaking his head Dave strode into his bedroom, directly for his bed, picking up a pamphlet he'd gotten about the city including major attractions he started to leaf through it. "Hmm....let's see there's a park, a farm, and a forest, as well as a lake, this this place really is beautiful..." Having made up his mind Dave walked over to his closet and selected...

111.content:
"The park sounds nice" Dave thought pulling out the a short-sleeved white shirt and black shorts, perfect jogging attire. It only took him moments to get dressed, although it took him several minutes to find a water bottle which was quickly filled and attached to his hip. "Might as well jog there, it didn't seem that far on the pamphlet and hopefully I'll learn a bit about the lay of the land" he thought. Taking several moments to lock down the house before he left, Dave set off at a brisk trot, his lanky legs carrying him at a respectable speed, soon leaving the quiet cul-de-sac he and Jim would call home for the foreseeable future. Dave was surprised at how crisp the air was, the quiet spring morning brought with it a gentle breeze and a clear azure sky. Dave jogged in peace for several minutes, simply enjoying the peace and quiet before he entered the tow proper, however the peace couldn't last and after a single car passed him it was like he was swallowed by the city proper.

It was nowhere near as intense as some of the large metropolitan areas but there were many more buildings and he was soon passing other residents of the town. Mammals, birds, reptiles, every single type of creature seemed to have several resident anthros, as he jogged though Dave couldn't hep but notice something...two things to be honest. The first thing he noticed was that there were many more women than men, at least he passed many more women than men, maybe 5, or 6 females to every male. The second thing he noticed was that he was being watched...or it felt like it anyways, nearly every woman he passed seemed to take a second glance at him, and he swore a few even turned and watched him jog past, one Dalmatian girl whistling at him as he jogged past.

While Dave didn't mind the attention, he felt a bit overwhelmed as there was one final observation specifically concerning the women of this town....they were stacked, every single one of them. Nearly every female he passed would put a supermodel to shame, large full and firm breasts dominated their chests, tight asses, long legs, and it was like a paradise. Dave couldn't really begrudge the women he passed from looking...as he was looking just as much in return. His eyes were admitted glued to the backside of a particularly voluptuous dove when “whump” his vision became nothing but pink as his head was surrounded by two large soft feathery orbs.

“’Giggle’ well aren’t you forward? A normal hello is nice but this works well enough too.” Before Dave could pull his head back to see just who was talking to him….and whose cleavage his head was currently buried in, two arms wrapped around his shoulders gently pulling him further into the soft downy canyon.

He was held there for several seconds before finally being released, looking up he saw a woman adorned in beautiful fine pink plumage, her long slender neck leading up to a curved black beak and gentle green eyes. Her feathers extended down to her wrists and ankles where the plumage fell away to the black keratin that make up birds feet and in this case hands. She was wearing nothing more than a blue bikini top and black shorts, the azure material of her bikini hugging her full soft breasts while the denim shorts were bursting trying to contain her thick full ass. He jumped a little as her long neck extended putting her face mere inches from his. “So, like what you see? You’ve been checking me out for a while now” she said her tone teasing as she looked him over.

“Oh…sorry” Dave replied cheeks flushing as he looked away abashedly, he was surprised when a slender finger gently pulled his face back to hers.

“Hey, I don’t mind” she said smiling as she stood up to her full height, only then did Dave truly realize height wise how much he was dwarfed by the flamingo woman standing in front of him. “I wouldn’t have this beautiful figure unless I wanted to show it off, oh and I’m Juliette by the way” she said.

“D-Dave” he replied, taking a moment to fully examine Juliette’s body.

“It’s nice to meet you Dave, well I really do hate to cut this short, but I’m running errands so…” her fingers dug into her pockets, pulling out a pen and a pad of sticky notes. Seconds later she was handing one to him “here’s my address and phone number, call me handsome, we’ll get to know each other better.” She took advantage of the pause to lean over and he felt her beak gently press against his cheek in a kiss. “Call me later” she said walking away, Dave watched her leave, his eyes focusing on her tail, which swayed side to side with the rhythmic movements of her ass as she walked and after she made a turn she was out of sight.

Dave simply stood there for several minutes, surprised at how in control of the conversation she’d been, pocketing the sticky note he continued on to the park and after several more minutes of jogging, and several catcalls later he made his way to the large central park. He wasn’t surprised at how well-kept he was, but he was surprised by the variety, there were several groves of trees as well as solitary ones scattered around to provide shade. Several flowerbeds lined the walking paths that weaved their way through the property. The most notable feature of the park was the large duck pond with its own little island that took up one whole side, the trails running around it in a large circle.

Dave watched as the town’s female inhabitants used the park to its fullest extent. Some were playing tag, some were jogging, there were several different sports matches going on, football, soccer…etc. Dave was a little happy as most of the girls who saw him waved, a few winked, and one saucy kangaroo even beckoned him over, except she did so by presenting her tail and waving it towards him. Dave was admittedly little overwhelmed as while he wanted to go out and see the town, make some new friends. Most of the town seemed to want to “make friends” with him in a completely different way, and truth be told he felt a little like a sheep in the lion’s den. Sitting down on the bench he thought about what he could do as there were several options open to him, he could just honestly go up and try to join one of the games or one of the solitary girls in what they were doing as he was sure he’d be welcomed with open arms…especially by that kangaroo girl. He could always just go somewhere else as there was still plenty of town still to explore, he could always just go home since he had done what he had set out to do. As he was thinking his fingers slipped into his pocket grasping the paper with Juliette’s number and address, he could always call her as he was sure she'd like to spend time with him. ‘What to do?’ he thought….

It had been almost a hundred years since doomsday, and humanity was still kicking. Over 10,000 thermonuclear bombs detonated over the course of a single day, throwing up enough ash to completely block out the sun for centuries. The few that survived the initial blasts were subject to seemingly eternal night and critically low temperatures… and yet, through the natural perseverance of man, a few managed to survive. They became a new breed of mankind, where all the petty distractions and meaningless drama of the modern world was replaced with pure, raw, brutal survival.

Of course, things have been getting better as the century progressed. A bit of sunlight was able to poke through the clouds of ash, and natural wildlife have been breeding to the point of restoring their numbers, although they were a bit mutated nowadays. Clayton was just a teenager, so this was the world he’d always known. He had no memories or nostalgia for the way the world used to be, before the bombs. Really, he had no reason to believe the world hadn’t always been this way. He had grown used to this world, and quite proficient in surviving its harsh conditions.

Clayton was travelling through Texas at the moment, though the state was unrecognizable now. He had to trudge slowly through thick snow, wearing two extra layers of thick clothing beneath his winter parka to help him survive the subzero temperatures. Even with all the extra protection, he was still absolutely freezing. This was partially because he had accidentally walked headlong into an intense blizzard! The wind was blowing so loudly it strained his ears, and he continually had to wipe snow off his goggles just to be able to see. He knew he had to find shelter to survive, but he seemed to be in the middle of an empty field of some sort, with no salvation in sight.

He unfortunately had to abandon his rucksack, containing all his supplies, and his only weapon — a rusty single shotgun — in the snow, just because they were slowing him down. He could come back for them later, he reasoned, once the blizzard had passed. While he tried to stay calm and focus on the task at hand, he could hear his breath becoming more and more panicked and belabored as the situation began to seem hopeless. All he could do is stumble through the snow blindly, hoping he would just bump into his salvation.

Unfortunately, he ended up stumbling into something much different — a cliff! “Shit!” He cried into his neck gaiter as his footing slipped, and he went falling over the edge! Luckily, it was only a ten foot fall… but unluckily, he landed on his left leg in just the wrong way, hearing a sickening crack as pain flooded his body. As he lied there, groaning in the snow at the bottom of the cliff, he grabbed along his leg to realize it was broken! To make matters worse, his goggles and facemask fell off during the fall, leaving his face exposed to the freezing temperatures. He felt around desperately for them, but without his goggles, he was completely blind. He rolled over onto his back in the snow, realizing how doomed he was.

“H-help!” He cried out. With his busted leg, his only chance now was to hope some kind soul was around to assist him. He knew it was futile — he was in the middle of nowhere! “Help, somebody! Please!” His exposed face was starting to freeze at a terrifying rate; he cried, only for his tears to freeze against his face. Eventually, his entire head started to feel numb, and his thoughts started to jumble together as he lost his senses. The unrelenting sense of brutal cold eventually sent the boy into a state of half-consciousness, from which he believed he would never wake…

Eventually, his numb mind could vaguely hear the sound of two, feminine voices, speaking over him in concerned tones. Soon, he felt strange, furry hands grab him by the arms and start dragging him slowly through the snow. He was too out of it to even register it at this point, though, so instead of reacting, he just drifted off to sleep…

┄┄┄


Hours later, Clayton woke with a start, as if shaken from a nightmare. At first, that’s exactly what he thought it was — just a terrible nightmare — but that hopeful thought was wiped away when he noticed his leg was still broken, his face still felt numb, and most concerningly, he had no idea where he was. He seemed to be in some kind of old, refurbished doctor’s office; he could still hear the blizzard raging outside. He was lying in some kind of hospital bed, and when he looked down, he noticed that his broken leg had been wrapped in thick bandages.

He leaned back, sighing in relief. Some good samaritan had rescued him in his time of need. He was almost excited to meet the people who lived here, and learn the history of this place. It didn’t take very long before someone came into check on him… though they certainly didn’t look like he expected.

He had never seen a mutant like this before. She had a face with a snout, reminiscent of a wolf, and light grey fur covered her entire body. Instead of hair, she had big, fluffy ears atop her head, and he noticed that she had a tail which wagged involuntarily behind her as she walked. She was wearing a teal pencil dress reminiscent of a scrub, with a white apron on top, which had a red first aid symbol printed on the front, leading him to believe she was some sort of nurse. For whatever reason, she was also wearing white fishnet stockings down to her boots.

She was obviously well-fed; all of the human women he met in the wasteland were scrawny and lanky, but this ‘nurse’ was downright voluptuous, with large, firm breasts that pushed up against the front of her dress, and thick, full hips. “Oh, good, you’re awake! Why, we were all so worried,” she said, sitting down on a chair by your best, crossing her slender legs as she sorts through her supplies. “How are you feeling? Do you have any sensation in the face?” From the sound of her voice, she was probably in her late 20’s or early 30’s, likely a full decade older then Clayton.

“It’s starting to feel a little, uh, prickly, I think,” Clayton says. He desperately wanted to ask her why she was so severely mutated, but he figured that would be rude. Besides, it’s not like she was deformed or anything; she actually had quite a perfect body, and if it wasn’t for her strange fur and snout, Clayton would probably consider her the most beautiful woman he’s ever seen.

“Mhmm. That’s a good sign,” she said with a smile, as she gently applied a warm sponge to your frigid nose. It felt rather nice. “You’re lucky we found you so quickly. That was quite a storm.”

“Y-yeah,” you said, looking around, still wanting an explanation. “What is this place?”

“This? Well, kiddo, you’ve stumbled upon Karnes City. Or, as it's called nowadays, 'Furtown',” she smiled. “Now, I can see the way you’re looking at me. I know you’ve probably never met a mutant like myself before. You should know that everybody in Furtown is like this, though — so if you have any questions, you should ask them now.”

He looks at her strangely. “Everyone’s… like you? What do you mean?”

“The term for the condition is ‘anthropomorphism’. Prior to doomsday, a few women in Karnes City were involved in a clinical trial, which experimented which fusing human and animals genetically,” she explained. “They all ended up looking like… this. At first they thought the experiment was a disaster, but when the bombs fell, it turned out this was actual the ideal body to surviving the conditions of a nuclear winter. Thus, only those few women survived…”

“So you’re all… 'anthros'?”

“Indeed,” she nodded. He can tell she’s had to explain all this before. It was like she was reading from a script. “I’m sure you came here to answer our request for mates, right?”

He raised a brow, uncomprehending. “I came here investigating some radio signals, but I didn’t hear anything about ‘mates’.”

“Oh… dear,” she frowned, her face going flush, as if panicked. “W-well… you see… as a side-effect of our mutations, us anthros are only capable of giving birth to other females. This is almost entirely a female society.” She explained, averting your gaze, already a little embarrassed. “In order to carry on our genes, we need… human males.”

Clayton stared at her, unsure of how to feel about this. “So you want me to…?”

“W-well, I mean, you’re under no obligation! You’re not going to be forced to do anything!” She insisted. “But, uh… males are so rare to find, your, err, 'seed' is considered a very valuable commodity around here... so if you decide to do any 'favors' for the girls in town, I'm sure they'd make it worth your while.” She coughed, trying to change the subject, obviously feeling a little awkward. You could see her blush through her fur. “Really, though, right now you should focus on getting some rest. We found you just in time, so your injuries won’t have any permanent effects.”

“Mm. That’s good news, at least,” Clayton say as she stands up, giving him some time to rest. “Thank you!” He calls as she walks out, before the door shuts behind her, leaving him alone with his thoughts. He lays there, listening to the clock ticking in the background as he considers his situation. The more he thought about it… the more 'Furtown' seemed like a paradise...
1551.title: Nuclear Winter

15511.content:
Layton got some intermittent, restless sleep, but the frostbite thawing on his face hurts too much for him to really get any rest, so he eventually just opted to lie there in bed, pondering his situation. He had gotten extremely lucky. He has come across tons of bodies over the years, from people who’ve simply getting caught outside during a blizzard. Getting rescued by this benevolent society was probably the best possible outcome he could’ve hoped for. Still, he were quite baffled by what he had seen. First off, why exactly were these mutants given animal characteristics, and why were they all born female? Second, did they really expect him to… impregnate some of them? He was a person, not a walking sperm dispenser. Before he could consider this further, though, another of the women suddenly slid open the door and walked into his hospital room.

When the wolf nurse he met earlier said that all the women here were ‘like her’, he thought she meant that they’d all look like wolves. This one, however, resembled an entirely different animal; not even a canine, but a full-fledged grizzly bear! She was also much, err, heavier then the wolf was; in a good way, of course. She definitely had a pear shape, with huge hips that were wider than her shoulders, though her bust left nothing to be desired, either. She was also about 6’5”, or about a head taller than he were. Squeezed around her curvy body, she wore a long, white blend coat over a familiar teal pencil dress, with a red first aid symbol printed on the right breast. She also wore round-rimmed glasses and a white nurse’s cap. She smiled as she closed the door behind he, walking over to his beside while holding a cardboard clipboard.

“I am Velia, the chief physician in this informory. Your doctor asked me to assess your condition and go over your options,” she said, sitting down on a wooden stool by his bed, which creaked beneath her size. “Please, give me a moment while I look over his notes.”

“... okay,” he nodded, and sat silently for a few moments while the bear read through her clipboard. “Hey. I, uh, left my gear out there when I fell,” Layton says, remembering the stuff he dropped. He really wanted to get it back before some wanderer grabs it; a lot of that stuff had sentimental value. “It shouldn’t be that far from where y’all found me. Is there any chance anybody here found it?”

“Not that I’ve heard, but our scavengers are very talented. I’m sure one can find it for you, no problem,” the bear looks up from her clipboard with a smile.

“Oh, great. Thanks!” He nods, impressed by how selfless these mutants were.

“Well, let’s not be too hasty. They don’t work for free,” she frowned, and he sighed. Of course. Nothing in this world is free. “While you are recovering, you will be provided with food, shelter and medical care for no charge, as you were technically brought here against his will,” she explained slowly, as if picking her words carefully. “If you want anything beyond that, though, you will have to pay your dues.”

“How am I supposed to do that?” He asks, furrowing his brow. “I can’t even walk.”

“Well, I don’t want to seem forceful, as you are still recovering and all, but I want to emphasize; your seed is a… very valuable commodity here. I recommend you leverage that ‘asset’ as best you can during your stay,” she says, “but we can just put a pin in that for now. Right now, I want to ask you some questions about your situation.”

Layton sighs, leaning back in bed. “Alright,” he nods, “ask away.”

She looks down at her clipboard, preparing her questions. “First of all, there’s the obvious; where are you from? Are you aligned with any factions?”

“Uh… well, I’m sort of just a drifter. I mean, I used to have a home, but it was… attacked,” Layton frowned, recalling some painful memories. He try to avoid going into detail. “Nowadays I just wander around on my lonesome.”

“Mhmm. So there’s no one looking for you then?” She asked.

“Doubt it.” Layton shakes his head.

“Alright. So you will be staying here for the entirety of your recovery, then,” she nods, writing it down on her clipboard. “So, do you drink? Smoke? Use drugs?”

“Nope,” he says simply, shaking his head again. She runs him through all the generic questions he had been expecting, and it wasn’t long before he grew bored. As she talked, though, he began to have another concern. Layton couldn’t help but notice that his face was still beet-red, with blisters and swelling in a few places, making jim like slightly like a mutant himself. “By the way… my face isn’t going to look like this forever, right?”

“Oh, no. However, you will want to try to avoid going outside too much in the next few weeks, to prevent the damage from worsening,” she explained. “Now, how is that leg of yours doing?”

“Uh… it’s fine. It... hurts whenever I move it,” he said, awkwardly. There wasn’t much to say. He’s pretty much just been feeling fine overall, though his face sort of hurt.

“Mhmm…” She nodded, looking down at her clipboard again. “Judging from what I’ve heard, I think you qualify to be loaned a wheelchair during your stay here. You know, in case you want to explore the town.”

“Oh, let me guess. You’re going to ask me to do you some ‘favors’ in return, though, right?” Layton rolled his eyes.

“Hehe! No, no. It’s free of charge, as long as you bring it back eventually,” the bear chuckled, amused by his cynicism. “If you’re proposing a roll in the hay, though, I certainly wouldn’t be opposed to the idea.” He was a little taken aback by this, but the way she was acting made it obvious she was joking. Velia stood up, and eventually made her way to the door once she was finished taking her notes. “Alright, eh, Layton, is it? You just wait right here. I’ll be back to show you how to use your chair.” With that, the door closed again, leaving him alone in the room once more.

As he laid there, staring at the ceiling, he thought; if one of these women end up asking him for a ‘favor’ or two… really what’s the harm?

┄┄┄


A few hours later, he emerged out of the front doors of the infirmary, rolling around in a specialized wheelchair designed for the snow and debri of the wasteland. It was sort of embarrassing, but he tried to remind himself that it was just temporary. As he expected, the community in ‘Furtown’ was very small, but very close. Along the outskirts of the city were huge concrete and scrap metal walls, with armed sentries atop constantly on lookout for raiders. If he had to take a guess, the entire ‘city’ was about two million square feet in all, about the size of a large shopping mall. The space was used well, though; around a hundred women lived out their lives within the walls of the small town.

He was baffled by them as he rolled past. Each ‘anthropomorph’ he saw seemed to be based on a different animal; he passed rodents, felines, marsupials, equines, creatures of all shapes and sizes! They seemed just as fascinated by him as he was by them. As he passed, he frequently caught them staring at him, or whispering to eachother excitedly. He wasn't sure if they were surprised to see a human, or just surprised to see a male. Either way, he was moderately embarrassed, being the center of attention as he travelled through town. Eventually, he decided he had to stop wandering aimlessly, and actually get something down in the brief window of time he could go outside before it got too cold.

One of his most pressing concerns was convincing a scavenger to go retrieve his stuff for him. He might have to do some ‘convincing’, but so be it. Then again, he was also getting pretty hungry. Perhaps this might be time to try out the local cuisine.
15511.title: The Road (to Recovery)

155111.content:
Latyon decides to deal with the most pressing matters on his mind first, before getting better acquainted with the town. He musters up the courage to ask around town for directions to the scavengers, until he finally makes his way to a big barracks, constructed of scrap metal. A woman sat on the front porch, idly toying with the lever-action rifle in her hands. She was dressed similarly to the other ‘warriors’ town, with a chainmail vest worn beneath a rugged, thick winter coat that reached her knees. She had the hood of her coat pulled up, so he had to come closer to notice that she seemed to be a hyena! He noticed she was also wearing jeans and combat boots, with a small pistol holstered on her belt.

She let's out that famous, screeching hyena laugh when she sees Layton sheepishly rolling up to the barracks. “So, they finally wrangled up a human boy, huh?” She laughed at the sorry sight of him. “Heh! To be honest, I was expecting something more…”

“Is there I can find some scavengers?” Layton tried to ignore her mockery, focusing on the task at hand.

“Yeah, we do scavenging jobs, among other things,” she nods with a curt shrug, once she’s calmed down. “What’s it to ya?”

“I lost some stuff out there during a blizzard,” he explained. “What will it cost to hire you to grab my gear for me? I can describe exactly where it. It’s not hard to find.”

“Do you even have anything to offer?” She asked, incredulous.

“Velia said I should ask about doing… ‘favors’,” Layton practically whispered, sheepishly.

The hyena started that sound loud, squealing laugh once again, leaving him feeling humiliated. He sat, there, blushing, as he waited for her to calm down. Occasionally, a curious passersby would stop and stare for a few seconds, furthering his embarrassment. “Pfft! Sorry, kid, but you’re barking up the wrong tree, there,” she finally says, wiping a tear from her face. Apparently, hyena are easy to amuse. Still, she eventually got down to business, standing up and gesturing to the door of the barracks. “Tell ya what, though. I know a pair o’ scavengers who might be interested. Want me to bring ‘em out for ya?”

“Sure, thanks,” he says, and wait patiently while the hyena heads inside, thanking his lucky stars that she at least wasn’t laughing at him anymore.

Eventually, another woman emerges from the barracks, this one some sort of feline. Looking at the color of her fur, he realizes she’s a cougar! She was wearing a brown jacket over a salvaged black, bulletproof vest, complete with leather boots. Even beneath her cozy clothing, you could tell she was quite slim and sylphlike; unlike the next woman to emerge, a butchy, six foot tall tiger woman. The tigress wore pure black, with a long, flowing robe. The tiger was around the same size as the bear you met earlier, but instead of having a few pounds of blubber, her’s was pure muscle. He noted her incredible, toned abs even through her robes. “Ooh! Layton! We’ve heard about you!” The cougar smiled, as she quickly skipped down the steps to you.

“Allow us to introduce ourselves. I am Allene, and this is my partner, Darci,” the tigress followed slowly, the stairs of the barracks creaking beneath her size.

“Nice to meet you,” he said, shaking their furry, paw-like hands. “You’re scavengers, right?”

“Yeah, Sixta told us what you wanted. You need your gear, right?” The cougar, ‘Darci’, smiled, her long tail waving excitedly behind her. “Well, we’d be perfectly willing to offer our services!”

“But first off, you don’t have to sit out here in the cold. Would you like to discuss this somewhere private?” The tiger, ‘Allene’, said quietly. Of course. He was going to be doing them some ‘favors’. He certainly didn’t want to discuss that in public.

“Uh, sure. Wherever you want,” he nods. Taking this is permission, the tiger grabs the back of his wheelchair and starts rolling him around town, her incredible strength allowing her to take him at frightening speeds. He becomes more and more nervous the farther the two took him. Just what were they planning for him? Did they really expect him to…? Of course, they were very attractive, and he certainly wouldn’t really mind, but… he barely knew them! This seemed like it was happening a little too quickly! Still, he tried to convince himself that he was just being overly nervous, as always. He could negotiate this into something he was comfortable with. They didn’t seem like they were planning on forcing him into anything.

The tiger eventually rolls him into a small cabin, kept warm by a fireplace in the corner and lit up by lanterns. “I’m sure you’ve been informed of the kind of… services the girls around here may be expecting,” she said, as she finally let go of his chair, letting him warm up in the cozy cabin.

“Yeah, the doc kept saying something about ‘favors’,” he replied, almost in a whisper.

“Me and Allene have been wanting to raise a kit of our own for… almost a year, now,” Darci said, wrapping an arm around Allene’s shoulder as they both stood before you, making their proposal. “If you’d be willing to help us out, we’d be more then willing to make it up to you!”

“So… what exactly does that entail?” He asks.

She shrugs. “Well, it’s really up to you. If you want us to go to the clinic and try DI, that’d be just fine,” she explains, “but if you’d prefer the quicker, more ‘natural’ route, we’re fine with that, too.”

Layton sit there for a moment, trying to figure out how to deal with this situation. He… wanted to help them out, but that might mean letting the random felines take his virginity, and even make him technically a father. It didn’t help that the two women were probably around a decade older than the nervous teen. “I mean… I’ve never really done anything like this, before,” he admits, sheepishly.

“If you’re uncomfortable, just say so,” Allene insists. “We can work out another sort of deal.”

“I don’t have anything else to offer,” he sighs, before going quiet again for a while, contemplatively. “This would just be a one-off thing, right?”

“Oh, yes. Us anthros are very fertile,” Darci nods with a smile. She quickly notices that that didn’t seem to make Layton feel any better. She leans forward, placing a hand on his shoulder reassuringly, speaking in a soothing, quiet voice. “Trust us, sweetheart. There’ll be no hang-ups, no tricks, no nothin’. Just spend a relaxing afternoon with us, and we’ll have your stuff sent to you by tomorrow morning. Okay?”

Layton can’t even try to think about this anymore. In his mind, it was too late to back out now. He needed to get this over with sooner or later. He just needed to work up the courage to say ‘yes’. “... okay,” he finally managed to nod, his worlds feeling like they were forcefully freed from his mouth.

“Fantastic! Trust me, you won’t regret this!” The cougar said, practically jumping with excitement. “Let’s get you settled in.” The tiger started moving his chair around again, and he quickly realized she was bringing him to their bedroom! As he grew nearer, he realized he had forgotten one crucial detail.

“So, uh, wait… who’s the lucky lady?”

Layton will be impregnating...
155111.title: The Aspiring Couple

info.brief_description: A father and his son who are humans moves in to a town populated by Furries!
info.description:
Dave Willis is a divorced 40-year-old father who wants to have a fresh start for himself and his son 15-year-old Jim, by moving in to a metropolitan town in the mid-west. Little do they know that this town is populated by furries, who´re happens to be VERY willing to get to know the newcomers!


Furtown-info:

Furtown is a peaceful community populated by furries. It has a beautiful park at the center, and just outside there´s a farm, a big lake, a large forrest with a small mountain in it and even a university. There´re mostly females here, and a few males, meaning the females can easily be sexually frustrated if they don´t have a good sex for awhile. And there are some cases of incest amongst the families (mothers with sons, sisters with brothers, daughters with fathers etc). When Dave and his son moves in, the females in town plans to, as they say, "Fuck Their Brains Out", whether they be in the neighborhood, in the park, in high school, in the forrest or by the lake!


Rules:

1. The females can be 16 to 50 years and have VERY HOT bodies! (Huge breasts, thin waists, big asses, wide hips etc.)

2. This story will have romance, sex and other mature content, furries, love and anything else you come up with

3. Try to add long chapters (a paragraph at least)

4. No offense, but no gay sex, OK with lesbian

5. NO VORE, WEIGHT GAIN, SHRINKING, etc!

6. There will be some incest

7. If you want to add other male humans or furries, then be my guest

Enjoy! (and please add!)


Reward: 1000 Gps per chapter
